componenttext: Two quick things. Basically, Mike, in your experience as you talked about living through all the different economies, how do you see jcpenney families right now in the tenure? How is it different now than 2008? And if I may, Ron, becoming America's favorite store with penney‚Äôs, you worked for 2 of them, Target and Apple, are there characteristics that you think make them a favorite?

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: Well, I think has Ron said, he'd prefer to talk at the end of January. He has spent a lot of work on the products. My experience recently has been that there's a little bit of disconnect between consumer spending and sentiments. Sentiment is at virtually
componenttext: Well, I think has Ron said, he'd prefer to talk at the end of January. He has spent a lot of work on the products. My experience recently has been that there's a little bit of disconnect between consumer spending and sentiments. Sentiment is at virtually an all-time low. So consumers don't feel necessarily good about their current circumstance, whether it's the cost of food and fuel or the expectation of the job situation or the equity in their house. Having said that, our strongest business is Sephora, which is not a price promotion business. It's not a -- something that people would necessarily see as a need, but it's the excitement in the fashion and newness gives us a lot of encouragement that Liz Claiborne and Mango and Call it Spring and Sephora and things that we've added are stimulating to consumers that are seeing something they like in the store. So I think the main thing has been, when do people feel more confident about kind of general -- their general family budget, and I think that may take some time. The political environment doesn't lend itself at the moment to a lot of confidence because it's in obviously a robust dialogue about the future entitlements and the future of budgets and the next year's election. I think we'd step to earn the business everyday by getting better service and having merchandise that people want and to make sure we plan it properly. So I think anybody that's been a student of the current economic climate will say it's been a more protracted downturn than anybody expected. But I think our sense is we're not slipping back into a double dip because more or less we're bumping along the top of the waves.

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: And any update on the Internet performance and how you see that going for the fourth quarter?
componenttext: And any update on the Internet performance and how you see that going for the fourth quarter?

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: On the front page of the Dallas Morning News this morning in the business section had the Internet businesses for the state of Texas, and we're the #2 largest Internet business behind Dell, which obviously is a very different business. So we still have a
componenttext: On the front page of the Dallas Morning News this morning in the business section had the Internet businesses for the state of Texas, and we're the #2 largest Internet business behind Dell, which obviously is a very different business. So we still have a very large Internet business. I think the difficulty has been that we've earned it by being a very large catalog retailer, and we've had to transform it while the locomotive was going down the track. So it's been very painful in the last several years. It's been a negative factor in our comps because we include that in our comp stores, but I do think it will be accretive going forward. So I think we've aligned the fashion offerings that we have in the store that customers are enjoying at the point of sale. Those are now largely available online, and we have 27 million customers in apparel that buy our apparel in the store that don't shop with us online, they're shopping someplace else. So the logic will be if they start to shop with us online, we have a big upside with our dotcom customer.

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Michael Exstein with Credit Suisse.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Michael Exstein with Credit Suisse.

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: Can you talk, Mike, a little bit about Mango, what you're seeing, talk about the impact in terms of traffic, profitability and so forth?
componenttext: Can you talk, Mike, a little bit about Mango, what you're seeing, talk about the impact in terms of traffic, profitability and so forth?

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: Mango, as you know, is a contemporary trendy line that we have now in 500 stores. They are one¬†of the true fast fashion retailers in the world. We're the only department store that really has a true fast fashion retail offer. When we started doing busine
componenttext: Mango, as you know, is a contemporary trendy line that we have now in 500 stores. They are one¬†of the true fast fashion retailers in the world. We're the only department store that really has a true fast fashion retail offer. When we started doing business with them, they had 12 locations in the United States, largely unknown in the United States but well known in Europe and throughout the rest of the world. Their alternative was to go out and find retail space, which would take them a decade to get to the same presentation, the same representations they've been able¬†to achieve with us in a year. So it's a win-win from our perspective. We give our customer choices, and they get exposure against their key competitors. I would say that the¬†-- it's resonated the best on the coast that typically is where the tourist customer is located and has encountered Mango in other places. I think that this fall, the pricing is now at the MNG level pricing that we knew it needs to be at the beginning when they had a few stores that reflected more to Mango pricing, which is somewhat higher. I think they were quite satisfied that they have the wherewithal in terms of design expertise and the supply chain and response time to give our customers newness and fashion on a regular basis, so it's been very well received. I think we're attracting customers that would not have shopped with us, and they're the most shop¬†-- cross-shopping with Sephora, Call it Spring and Mango. So it tells us that the younger 18-¬†to¬†40-year-old age range is the customer that Mango is attracting.

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: So do you think that if the home business is really sort of dragging you down right now more than anything else?
componenttext: So do you think that if the home business is really sort of dragging you down right now more than anything else?

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: Well, we know the home businesses is the worst business. I mean, I think, whether it's the gold and diamond business, which is obviously also a tough business in this environment, or furniture and window covering and the dotcom businesses. The dotcom¬†--
componenttext: Well, we know the home businesses is the worst business. I mean, I think, whether it's the gold and diamond business, which is obviously also a tough business in this environment, or furniture and window covering and the dotcom businesses. The dotcom¬†-- 55% of our dotcom business is home. So as it lags, it's obviously between that and the restructuring of the dotcom business as people are aligned with the store inventory. As we've said, this is a transition year. We're building a strong foundation, but it's painful in the process. And I think that in the long run, it will have been time well spent and effort rewarded by what can be built upon the foundation.

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Paul Lejuez with Nomura.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Paul Lejuez with Nomura.

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: So when you talk about the financial impact of executing the new pricing strategy, is there anything beyond an inventory write-down that would be included in that? And then just secondly on inventory levels, where do you plan¬†to end¬†fourth quarter, and
componenttext: So when you talk about the financial impact of executing the new pricing strategy, is there anything beyond an inventory write-down that would be included in that? And then just secondly on inventory levels, where do you plan¬†to end¬†fourth quarter, and how are you thinking initially about 2012?

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: I think as Ron mentioned in his remarks, he is looking forward¬†to sharing that in January. The obvious answer is we intend to end this season with the right level of inventory for what we see in the¬†first quarter, so that's already bought, so we know th
componenttext: I think as Ron mentioned in his remarks, he is looking forward¬†to sharing that in January. The obvious answer is we intend to end this season with the right level of inventory for what we see in the¬†first quarter, so that's already bought, so we know that, so it's not a mystery. And we feel quite confident that our costing is so much better, somewhat better than we achieved in the fall but still at a higher level in the previous years. So I think the teams feel very strongly that they have planned well for the transition from January¬†to February.

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of Wayne Hood with BMO Capital Markets.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of Wayne Hood with BMO Capital Markets.

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: Mike, I just 2 questions. I was wondering as you sit down and thought about the business and the next phase of it, how do you kind of balance kind of reimagining the business, as you've called it or Ron has called it, against moving faster than where the
componenttext: Mike, I just 2 questions. I was wondering as you sit down and thought about the business and the next phase of it, how do you kind of balance kind of reimagining the business, as you've called it or Ron has called it, against moving faster than where the customer is, or you start doing things that are away from what they look to you for, so the weakness maybe just a function of the economy, and you start making these changes, and you move away from where the core customer would expect you¬†to provide?

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: Well, first of all, we have a huge opportunity with the existing customer. We're only 7% of their wallet. So an extra visit means an enormous amount¬†to get about between 4 and 6 visits depending where there's a mall store or not mall store. So our existi
componenttext: Well, first of all, we have a huge opportunity with the existing customer. We're only 7% of their wallet. So an extra visit means an enormous amount¬†to get about between 4 and 6 visits depending where there's a mall store or not mall store. So our existing customers are our best place to look for additional volume. Half of the families in America is a very large footprint, so I think that's probably the biggest opportunity. Having said that, the new things we've added have attracted the young customers. We know that there's over 0.25 million new customers came that never bought in jcpenney before that bought Liz Claiborne, so we know those are new customers. And I think we can trace the other attractions of having a similar expectation. So I don't think there's a lot of risk in terms of the changes being made. The risk is clearly not the downside. I think the opportunity is in the upside, people finding a broader range of merchandise, more excitement, price merchandise and a customer experience that we think has been certainly recognized by American Express. And in our survey, they're going¬†to get a great customer service when they buy that merchandise. So we're confident that the underrepresented market, the 18- to 35-year old is starting¬†to discover jcpenney, and we'll speak more about it.

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: My second question, I guess, is part of this process into '12 and beyond. Is there an ongoing assessment to potentially more store closings? Because it looked like¬†to us some data that we looked at was about 5% of your store base were malls that were put
componenttext: My second question, I guess, is part of this process into '12 and beyond. Is there an ongoing assessment to potentially more store closings? Because it looked like¬†to us some data that we looked at was about 5% of your store base were malls that were putting out less than $150 a foot, which would imply maybe the malls are very unproductive and maybe your stores aren't productive. I mean, where are you with the assessment of that and being able¬†to maybe work out of those locations better now than you would have been able¬†to a year or 2 years ago?

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: Well, I think, our habit has been¬†-- our practice has been to look at all stores every year in terms of their contribution, and that won't change. A number of relocations occurred in the last 3 or 4 years as we moved out of locations that had various dif
componenttext: Well, I think, our habit has been¬†-- our practice has been to look at all stores every year in terms of their contribution, and that won't change. A number of relocations occurred in the last 3 or 4 years as we moved out of locations that had various difficulties, whether it's the mall or a particular store. So I really don't see an acceleration of closings. I think it's a question of analysis of how they're performing, tests done every year. I think, if anything, the well-financed mall developers are starting to reinvest in their properties again. And we stand to benefit¬†from that to the extent they bring new anchors in, new ideas in, like an Apple store, for example, an Apple store is the most productive thing that can happen¬†to a mall. It attracts a broad range of customers, all of those customers. All those customers are opportunities for us. So I think our biggest opportunity frankly is the jcpenney brand. So to the extent we elevate the brand and get people¬†to discover who we are that we have style, we have quality, we have a very compelling price, that should appeal¬†to a much broader audience.

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: Our next question comes from the line of David Glick with Buckingham Research.
componenttext: Our next question comes from the line of David Glick with Buckingham Research.

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: Just a question about -- some of your suppliers have talked publicly about your cutting off replenishment orders as part of your reticketing and repricing strategy. I was wondering if you could comment on your Q4 replenishment strategy and if that's the c
componenttext: Just a question about -- some of your suppliers have talked publicly about your cutting off replenishment orders as part of your reticketing and repricing strategy. I was wondering if you could comment on your Q4 replenishment strategy and if that's the case, how do you plan¬†to make sales plan in those areas of you're not necessarily replenishing key sizes and colors?

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011
componenttextpreview: I think that's an exaggeration on their part. We are modifying our basic flow in order¬†to get through the transition. It's certainly not going to affect our stock levels to a degree that the customer will notice. We are committed¬†to making sure we're in
componenttext: I think that's an exaggeration on their part. We are modifying our basic flow in order¬†to get through the transition. It's certainly not going to affect our stock levels to a degree that the customer will notice. We are committed¬†to making sure we're in stock in sizes and colors and the basics. But 40% of our business is run on our basic program, and that won't be affected. I think that while it's a different experience for each supplier in terms of what their needs are, in terms of repricing our merchandise for the spring season, I think most have handled it very, very well. So there may be some carping here and there because we they have to do something different, I think it will pay out in the long run.

headline: J. C. Penney Company, Inc., Q3 2012 Earnings Call, Nov 14, 2011

componenttext: Well, thank you very much. We enjoyed the call and look forward¬†to speaking to you in the future.
